page.title: 09MY EVENING WALK
page.content:
{ LIZZIE HOPPER AGED 8 YEARS
ON SUNDAY I WENT FOR A WALK BY THE RIVER SIDE WITH JULIAN. FIRST WE HELPED MY DAD GET THE COWS INTO THE PARLOUR THEN WE SET OFF FROM DURHAM FIELD. WE WERE WALKING IN A WOOD WHEN A PHEASANT FLEW UP AND WE LOOKED IN THE GRASS AND THERE WERE FIVE BABIES. WHEN THEY SAW US THEY RAN. JULIAN CAUGHT ONE AND HE LET ME HOLD IT. AT FIRST IT WRIGGLED,BUT THEN IT STOPPED. IT WAS VERY SOFT. THEN I PUT IT DOWN AND CARRIED ON WE WALKED A LITTLE WAY AND WE SAW A DIPPER THEN WE CAME TO SOME BIG NETTLES. THERE WAS A TREE THAT HAD FALLEN DOWN. WE WALKED ALONG IT SO THAT WE WOULD NOT GET STUNG. THEN WE CAME TO SOME BIG ROCKS, THERE WAS A BIG HOLE, NEARLY AS BIG AS ME, THERE WAS GRASS COVERING THE HOLE AND I FELL IN.
